channel.title: Opinion on nuaNce's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Opinion on nuaNce's blog

item.title: Why I Stopped Using Windows
item.description: Before we begin, a confession, I used to really like Windows, I admit that it was an “ignorant bliss” kind of thing, but back then I didn’t really know much better. I used it often and started liking it even more when I began using some of it’s more hidden, “power user oriented” features, such as the built in window management and multitasking capabilities. And while I did have quite a good time in my years using Windows, reality dawned on me in early 2020.

item.title: Some of My Favorite Software
item.description:
Just a list of some software I find nice to use. A lot of these correlate with my stars on github, so be sure to check them out as well if you want some other nice things to use. My preferences with software usually boil down to:

  • It gets the job done
  • It’s smaller in size than similar software
  • It’s free and open source
  • It’s not overrated normie shit
  • And it integrates well with my workflow

Now with that out of the way, here is the list:

item.title: My Top 10 Best Looking Cars
item.description: I’ve always liked cars and have been reading automotive journalism for many years now. While many things come into play when considering a vehicle to buy, none, in my opinion, are as important as how good your car looks. So I’ve compiled a list of what I think are the best looking cars that I have ever seen. Expect this list to vary over time, however, since it’s hard for me not to change my mind about these things all the time:
